template.name: Template OS Linux Prom
template.description: Official Linux template using node exporter. version: 0.15

step.params: //count the number of cores return JSON.parse(value).length

item.name: Available memory
item.description: Available memory, in Linux, available = free + buffers + cache. On other platforms calculation may vary. See also: https://www.zabbix.com/documentation/current/manual/appendix/items/vm.memory.size_params

item_prototype.name: #{#CPUNUM}: CPU idle time
item_prototype.description: The time the CPU has spent doing nothing.

item_prototype.name: #{#CPUNUM}: CPU system time
item_prototype.description: The time the CPU has spent running the kernel and its processes.

item_prototype.name: #{#CPUNUM}: CPU user time
item_prototype.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that are not niced.

item_prototype.name: #{#CPUNUM}: CPU steal time
item_prototype.description: The amount of CPU 'stolen' from this virtual machine by the hypervisor for other tasks (such as running another virtual machine).

item_prototype.name: #{#CPUNUM}: CPU softirq time
item_prototype.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing software interrupts.

item_prototype.name: #{#CPUNUM}: CPU nice time
item_prototype.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that have been niced.

item_prototype.name: #{#CPUNUM}: CPU iowait time
item_prototype.description: Amount of time the CPU has been waiting for I/O to complete.

item_prototype.name: #{#CPUNUM}: CPU interrupt time
item_prototype.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing hardware interrupts.

item_prototype.name: #{#CPUNUM}: CPU guest time
item_prototype.description: Guest time (time spent running a virtual CPU for a guest operating system)

item_prototype.name: #{#CPUNUM}: CPU guest nice time
item_prototype.description: Time spent running a niced guest (virtual CPU for guest operating systems under the control of the Linux kernel)

discovery_rule.name: Mounted filesystem discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of file systems of different types as defined in global regular expression "File systems for discovery".

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template OS Linux Prom:node_exporter.vfs.fs.pused[{#FSNAME}].last()}>{$STORAGE_UTIL_CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Template OS Linux Prom:node_exporter.vfs.fs.total[{#FSNAME}].last()}-{Template OS Linux Prom:node_exporter.vfs.fs.used[{#FSNAME}].last()})<5G or {Template OS Linux Prom:node_exporter.vfs.fs.pused[{#FSNAME}].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space critical status
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Space used: {ITEM.VALUE3} of {ITEM.VALUE2} ({ITEM.VALUE1}), time left till full: < 24h. Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$STORAGE_UTIL_CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - Disk free space is less than 5G. - Disk will be full in less than 24hours.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template OS Linux Prom:node_exporter.vfs.fs.pused[{#FSNAME}].last()}>{$STORAGE_UTIL_WARN:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Template OS Linux Prom:node_exporter.vfs.fs.total[{#FSNAME}].last()}-{Template OS Linux Prom:node_exporter.vfs.fs.used[{#FSNAME}].last()})<10G or {Template OS Linux Prom:node_exporter.vfs.fs.pused[{#FSNAME}].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space warning
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Space used: {ITEM.VALUE3} of {ITEM.VALUE2} ({ITEM.VALUE1}), time left till full: < 24h. Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$STORAGE_UTIL_CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - Disk free space is less than 10G. - Disk will be full in less than 24hours.

dependency.name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space critical status
dependency.expression: {Template OS Linux Prom:node_exporter.vfs.fs.pused[{#FSNAME}].last()}>{$STORAGE_UTIL_CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Template OS Linux Prom:node_exporter.vfs.fs.total[{#FSNAME}].last()}-{Template OS Linux Prom:node_exporter.vfs.fs.used[{#FSNAME}].last()})<5G or {Template OS Linux Prom:node_exporter.vfs.fs.pused[{#FSNAME}].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)

trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Free inodes is critically low, below {$INODE_PFREE_CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%

dependency.name: {#FSNAME}: Free inodes is critically low, below {$INODE_PFREE_CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%

trigger.name: High swap space usage (free: {ITEM.VALUE1}, total: {ITEM.VALUE2})
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger is ignored, if there is no swap configured
